vfsCommandLine

Class vfsCommandLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • vfsCommandLine.vfsCommandLine

  • public class vfsCommandLine
extends java.lang.Object
    The VFS Command Line provides a way to interact with the VFS Core and VFS disks through a simple command-line interface. It can manage multiple VFS disks, create and delete them, and manage the files and folders contained inside.
    Author:
    Simon Rodriguez

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Core core
      Keeps reference to the currently opened disk, via its Core instance.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Core> openCores
      Act as a list of opened VFS disks and their associated cores

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void cd(java.lang.String[] args)
      to change the current position in the VFS .. must go to parent . represent current directory
      private void cp(java.lang.String[] args)
      to copy, within the VFS in argument, the content of a file/directory whose absolute name is source path into a target file/directory whose absolute name is the last argument.
      private void crvfs(java.lang.String[] args)
      create a new vfs at the specified path, with the specified size (in kB)
      private void displayHelp()
      display a useful list of commands, detailed with their arguments
      private void expvfs(java.lang.String[] args)
      exports the elements passed as arguments from the command-line loop
      private void find(java.lang.String[] args)
      to search if a file named filename is stored in the VFS named in argument, shall return the absolute path of the sought file if it is present in the VFS, null otherwise This search action will be done by using the implemented visitor pattern in the method Search of the core and return the name, the size and the path
      private void free(java.lang.String[] args)
      to display the quantity of free/occupied space for VFS named in argument
      private void impvfs(java.lang.String[] args)
      imports the elements passed as arguments from the command-line loop
      private void ls(java.lang.String[] args)
      Lists the element at the current or designated path, with the -l option used to display sizes
      private void lvvfs(java.lang.String[] args)
      close an opened VFS, removing it from the list of opened cores, and removing it if it is the current used core.
      void mainLoop()
      Executes the main loop of the Command-Line
      private void mv(java.lang.String[] args)
      to change the name of a file/directory with absolute name oldpath (args[2)] in the new absolute name newpath (args[3]) of the VFS named vfsname (args[1]).
      private void opvfs(java.lang.String[] args)
      Open the vfs passed in the arguments
      private void rm(java.lang.String[] args)
      to remove a file/directory with absolute name pathname (last of 2 arguments) from the VFS passed in argument.
      private void rmvfs(java.lang.String[] args)
      Remove the VFS disk at the specified path if it exists
